data.title: DePaul University Blue Demons
data.meta_description: Elijah Fisher (22) Guard - 2022-23 (Texas Tech) Played in 28 games with one start in his freshman season, averaging 3.3 points and 2.0 rebounds per game. Sco...
data.text:
2022-23 (Texas Tech)

Played in 28 games with one start in his freshman season, averaging 3.3 points and 2.0 rebounds per game.

Scored a season-high eight points against Jackson State in non-conference play and then again in a home loss to No. 24 TCU where he was 3-for-4 from the field.

Made his only start of the season against Kansas State and finished with two points and three rebounds.

Recorded a career-high nine rebounds in a win over LSU, while also having five points and two steals.

Finished the season shooting 46.1 percent from the field.

Team Canada

Averaged 11.7 points, 6.4 rebounds and 2.7 assists per game in the 2023 FIBA Under-19 World Cup.

Scored a team-best 18 points against Slovenia in the Round of 16 on 8-of-13 shooting in addition to 11 rebounds.

Made his Canadian national team debut in 2022, helping Canada win bronze at the FIBA Under-19 World Cup.

Won MVP honors at the BioSteel All-Canadian game in Toronto with a 28-point performance.

High School

Reclassified to the 2022 class as a consensus five-star from ESPN, Rivals and 247Sports.

Was the No. 15 ranked player by Rivals in the Class of 2023 before deciding to reclassify, holding 21 offers from the top programs in the nation.

Competed at the varsity level since sixth grade at Crestwood Academy in Toronto.

Averaged 28 points, 13 rebounds, seven assists and three steals per game as a junior.

Personal

Son of Rohan and Thelia Fisher.

Has four brothers - Jahyea, Jordan, Isaiah and Daniel
